description: Deficiency of n, or 2n - (sum of divisors of n).
comments: Records for the sequence of the absolute values are in A075728 and the indices of these records in A074918. - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 02 2007a(n) = 1 iff n is a power of 2. a(n) = n - 1 iff n is prime. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 30 2014
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, Section B2.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..2000
Nichole Davis, Dominic Klyve and Nicole Kraght, On the difference between an integer and the sum of its proper divisors, Involve, Vol. 6 (2013), No. 4, 493-504; DOI: 10.2140/involve.2013.6.493
example: For n = 10 the divisors of 10 are 1, 2, 5, 10, so the deficiency of 10 is 10 minus the sum of its proper divisors or simply 10 - 5 - 2 - 1 = 2. - _Omar E. Pol_, Dec 27 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
